chapter.title: &kw-hos-tm; 5.0: Delta Upgrades
chapter.para: It is now possible to apply minor, patch and hot-fix updates using delta kits. These delta kits contain only the set of changes directly related to the update, so they are smaller in size, and more importantly, they reduce the impact of the update on a running cloud, by only modifying the services that have changed in that release.
A full &kw-hos; kit contains the following elements:

listitem.para: A set of packages: &hlinux; debs and RHEL rpms.
A set of python virtual environments (one per service/distro combination).
A set of Ansible playbooks for both &clm; setup and carrying out lifecycle operations for an OpenStack cloud (deploy, upgrade, etc.)
A set of input model yaml files, which contains both &kw-hos; service definitions and example sets of cloud model files.
A set of config file symlinks, which determines the configuration files that are exposed for customer modification in the my_cloud area on the &clm;.

chapter.para: A patch kit will contain only the venvs that have changed (relative to the prior release). So in comparison to the full kit, a patch kit will have:

listitem.para: The set of new or modified venvs relative to the previous release.

A complete set of Ansible playbooks, input model yml file and config file symlinks. Regardless of the changes being supplied in a minor/patch update kit, these will always be supplied in full. This size of these artefacts is insignificant in comparison with hlinux/RHEL packages and service venvs.

chapter.para: There are a number of considerations to take into account when using delta upgrades:

listitem.para: The use of a patch kit does not simplify the operations needed to upgrade your cloud - the same upgrade procedure will be followed whether using a patch kit or a full kit.
A minor, patch or hotfix release can only be applied on top of a cloud running with the immediately preceding release, for example:
2.1.5 delta update can be applied on top of a 2.1.4 cloud
2.1.5 delta update cannot be applied on top of a 2.1.3 cloud
The delta update process will not support major upgrades, e.g. 2.x to 3.0, or any upgrade involving a change in OpenStack release.
The individual service venvs in a patch kit are complete venvs, not patches for the venvs.
